body_html:
Actually after thinking a bit, I can see your logic -- using A.op instead of A may forward walks to include chains of computation that don't include A which would also be counter-intuitive.

I was too used to thinking of TensorFlow not having a concept of tensor (since the graph only contains ops, and you can't compute any tensor individually without computing all of the other tensors on the op).
body_text:

I was too used to thinking of TensorFlow not having a concept of tensor (since the graph only contains ops, and you can't compute any tensor individually without computing all of the other tensors on the op).
body:
Actually after thinking a bit, I can see your logic -- using `A.op` instead of `A` may forward walks to include chains of computation that don't include `A` which would also be counter-intuitive.

I was too used to thinking of TensorFlow not having a concept of tensor (since the graph only contains ops, and you can't compute any tensor individually without computing all of the other tensors on the op).
